website_summaries.verdict: This is the perfect book for anyone looking to learn about edible wild plants, and its vibrant photos make it easy to identify each plant.
pros: Showcases colorful real-life images rather than drawings, making it easier to identify a plant
Book is heavy-duty, despite being paperback, and can stand up to repeated use
Discusses a wide range of plants – over 200
cons: Book does not discuss toxic plants

customer_reviews.title: Great Edible Plant Field guide Book.
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy to understand book guide on edible plants with full color pictures. It has information on seasons and shows what region of the United States the plants are likely to be found. It also has recipes and other information plus on poisonous plants and look alikes. I used an earlier addition of this feild guide and found it very useful in derermining edible plants. I found food I would have likely not eaten without this reference. Its great for backwoods camping and backpacking or even desert hiking. No info on mushrooms. And includes nutbearing trees.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Good book for foraging for wild greens
customer_reviews.text: Love the colorful pictures. Other books for years had drawings but this book has colorful pictures to identify the plant. So much better. My grandmother and I used to go 'greening' each Spring and she knew everything about edible plants. Haven't looked myself for years because not sure what was what due to faulty memory and line drawings in books. This renews my interest in foraging for greens once again as can really see what the plant looks like.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Edible Plant Identification Guide
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best book on edible plant identification available. Clear sharp COLOR photo of each one and on heavy duty pages. It fits well in my side BDU pants pocket. Little expensive, but in this case you really get what you pay for. Not only will I recommend to friends, but a friend of mine that's a survivalist took one look at it and went out and bought his own copy (he already has 6 other books, and thinks this is the best of the best).
customer_reviews.author: genecharris

customer_reviews.title: Great resource-I always take it when I go foraging.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite, best, most-used books for foraging. I take it everywhere when I go out in the woods. I'll wear this book out from over-use and then I'll get another one to wear out. To improve my plant ID, I press a sample from each plant I find and ID on the relevant page. This is a good all-around book to have on your wild edibles shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Polarbear

customer_reviews.title: Awful pictures
customer_reviews.text: Horrible pictures. I take better photos with my phone than the ones in this book. Since some plants are inedible photos should be high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: I don’t understand the hype
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this book based on the good reviews. The reviews mainly said the photos in the book were good. I’m honestly very disappointed with purchase and feel like I wasted $13. The photos don’t really show much at all. A lot of the photos are way too zoomed in and you don’t get a feel for what the whole plant looks like. There has to be a better book out there. I’m going to return this book.
customer_reviews.author: S. Parke

customer_reviews.title: ALL OF THE YES
customer_reviews.text: This book is worth its weight in gold if you like to know what you can/can't eat. This is the number one guide. I have made countless salads from my lawn weeds, and learned of many trail nibbles, Greenbrier's my personal fave. I have also compiled a plethora of notes on medicinal, meat prep, water, everything. This is my go to book. If I travel further than 50 miles from home, it always comes with, sealed in a watertight bag.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Beasley

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate with bad photography.
customer_reviews.text: The photos range from okay to really useless, many are not only black and white but also blurry. The information is also inaccurate as many of the plants in this book (wild onion for example) are found far beyond the range that the book notes. Most of the plants are in the east- it’s obvious that the authors know next to nothing of wild plants found in the western United States.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good book with clear information and color pictures.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with it. Priced right though shipping was a bit slow it came in almost unused condition and is very informative for anyone with an interest in edible plants. It also warns of poisonous and look-alike plants that are dangerous. It does not have mushrooms but that doesn't bother me as they aren't really plants and make me nervous as a wild picked food.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: ... I find myself still googling species on my phone even with the book in hand.
customer_reviews.text: Decent guide except for the pictures. Some of them are a little out of focus which makes identifying plants challenging. Many plants include only one photograph, when a photo of, for example, the flower, AND leaf would make identification easier and safer. While most are in color, some are not. Unfornately, I find myself still googling species on my phone even with the book in hand. Also, the little maps of the areas each plant is found are small and difficult to see specific regions.
customer_reviews.author: K.G.

customer_reviews.title: Basically useless
customer_reviews.text: Don't know what book the great reviews are for (the author I think has written other ones). This book is basically useless. It's really small and the few pictures it has are terrible quality. As others have mentioned they are so zoomed in you don't know what you are looking at. And I'm familiar with plants but couldn't decipher by picture alone what I was looking at. A foraging book without good pictures is nonsense. I rarely return books, even ones I don't like, because I always figure I could find some use for it. Not this one. I wouldn't have bought this for $5 let alone $14.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: If your a outdoorsman/huntsman like me and you don't buy any thing else on ...
customer_reviews.text: If your a outdoorsman/huntsman like me and you don't buy any thing else on Amazon today buy this book. This is by far the best wild edibles book I have ever seen and I own a few. Its small compact and reads like a true guide book. I carry two books in the woods with me the bible and this book.
customer_reviews.author: man with no name

customer_reviews.title: Great book with printing issues
customer_reviews.text: I actually really like this book and I love how it’s organized by season. It will be really helpful when spring comes. My only issue is that I believe I got a bad copy. Several of the photo pages are printed in black and white which doesn’t make sense, nor does it flow with the rest of the book. I attempted to reach out to both the publisher and Amazon to see if this was indeed an error, but no one has been able to tell me. That aside, this is a wonderful resource to add to your library.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Keith

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Book
customer_reviews.text: Product came heavily damaged from the post, with the paper cover having a large rip in it and the body of the book having a plethora of dents and dings. All of this seems arbitrary when compared to what is inside. All internal pages are in perfect glossy condition. There are five different ways you can search for a plant you are wondering about, and this book even includes a section on 20 poisonous look-alike plants. There are also two pages in my book that are in black and white, while the rest of the book is in full color. Not sure what that is about but I do not mind very much. Recommended for hikes!
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great photos with plant characteristics and variations.
customer_reviews.text: Well photographed, excellent notes covering plant characteristics and variations - a great guide book for forging with confidence. It does cover other parts of the country, but is very good for the Eastern deciduous forest area to the central United States. Remember, if unsure, DO NOT EAT any portion of a plant - be positive. This guidebook is very, very good - well worth the purchase (and peace of mind) for positive plant identification.
customer_reviews.author: Gaye Hill

customer_reviews.title: NOT THE BEST
customer_reviews.text: The print is small and is broken up with some bold and some regular type in the same sentence to me it is hard to read. There are many good pictures but not all. The plant coverage is very broad and inclusive. The print style and size is my reason for three stars.
customer_reviews.author: P. L. R.

customer_reviews.title: No Horseradish ?????
customer_reviews.text: Just received and the first thing i looked for was Horseradish. It's not included as an edible plant. I live in NY.... Horseradish is the springtime plant of the North East. I am very disappointing. Raspberries to you
customer_reviews.author: dfresh

customer_reviews.title: wow i can't fully express the amazing amount of information and great pictures this book as ...
customer_reviews.text: wow i can't fully express the amazing amount of information and great pictures this book as for identifying and knowing what is safe to eat and what isn't. This is the best plant food identification book out there and any self respecting prepper should have this in their library to get familiar with ways to collect more food. realistically 80% of food is harvested and 20% is caught/hunted in a survival situation.
customer_reviews.author: Trell

customer_reviews.title: Handy Guide!
customer_reviews.text: This book features over 200 wild edible plants. You will want to do further research on the plants before you go out eating them. Some of the photographs are black and white which provides little use in effective identification of the plant. I also appreciate the section on toxic plants.
customer_reviews.author: Sapphire Watchorn

customer_reviews.title: Needs better indexing system
customer_reviews.text: Lots of info and pix but listed alphabetically. If you have no idea the name of a weed it'll take you an hour to figure out if it is edible.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't have some plants that are common to northwest
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter since we have a lot of edible and non edible berries on our property and she loves to forage. But it didn't even have her favorite one, the huckleberry. So she was pretty bummed. It also didn't have anything about this other berry that's growing that we were wanting to know about so it became kind of useless.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Edible Wild Plants:  A North American Field Guide
customer_reviews.text: This book of Edible Wild Plants is well written with beautiful pictures and text describing which parts of the plant are edible and some recipes in the use of many of those plants. It also indicates which part of the country, even by state, where the plants can be found with a description of the type of growing area preferred by each type of plant, as well as the growing season when the plants will be available.Additionally, it addresses the problem of look-alike poisonous plants and the identification of same. Very important to know! I was extremely pleased with this book.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hanska

customer_reviews.title: Helpful!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend and I are slowly trying to move more off grid and live a self-sufficient lifestyle. This book has been awesome to thumb through and look things up to brainstorm what we can do with the things that grow in our vicinity. I love that it warns you which plants have poisonous twins or warns you that if you don't prepare it in a specific way, it may make you ill. I love that every plant has a listed use. I can't wait for spring.
customer_reviews.author: Kenzie

customer_reviews.title: Good color photos
customer_reviews.text: I like the color photos and the description of how to prepare or eat the plants. The way the book is laid out and organized is not intuitive though. Several of the plants say that there is a look alike version of the plant that is poisonous, but doesn't help you identify the difference. My initial impression is that it would be a good book to have so long as you had another book to go along with it and help - which makes me question the usefulness of this one in the first place. Maybe I should have bought a more detailed book that applies just to my region and it would have been a better fit.
customer_reviews.author: olinselot

customer_reviews.title: Very knowledgeable book for us beginner foragers
customer_reviews.text: This book is my new go to and a must for a bug out bag. I had no idea just how many plants in my yard and woods were not only edible, but highly medicinal. As a beginner forager I was always nervous of confusing a plant with a poisonous look alike. Not with this book! There’s a section on each plant that lets you know. I highly recommend this book!
customer_reviews.author: Sassenach

customer_reviews.title: Great Book
customer_reviews.text: I like having this with me on long camp-outs. If I have to forage I know what I can safely eat. This would be a good gift item too.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great informative book.
customer_reviews.text: Book with great information! Only reason I am not giving this 5 stars is some of the photos are black and white. Seems color photos would be better when proper identification is key. Informs on identification, collection, and preperation for cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Greg R.

customer_reviews.title: Edible wild plant book
customer_reviews.text: Like this a lot great ideas for natural edible food as well as a Wonderful addition to our collection for off grid living.
customer_reviews.author: Laura L. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Nice field guide
customer_reviews.text: Good sturdy book that is lovely to use in the field. I highly recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Luhrs

customer_reviews.title: No nutritional info.
customer_reviews.text: Nutritional information isn’t listed. Does marestail or lambs quarters have a lot of calcium? No way to tell from this book.
customer_reviews.author: Susie L. Tattershall

customer_reviews.title: ... really explore this book as much as I would like. However
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had time to really explore this book as much as I would like. However, I found some answers to some of the plant questions that I had. I even found some edible plants that I used to snack on when I was younger, I just didn't know the name. For me, this book is a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice book
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoy the pictures that help identify what we are looking at and for.
customer_reviews.author: andrea bomar

customer_reviews.title: Edible Wild Plants
customer_reviews.text: I like the book very much but every so many pages only show black and white photos, no color. Wished I had noticed this sooner. Maybe it was misprinted?
customer_reviews.author: momof2

customer_reviews.title: Maps
customer_reviews.text: Appreciate the maps showing where the plants are located and the note on poisonous plants that might be mistaken for the entry.
customer_reviews.author: Couldbeme

customer_reviews.title: really in depth
customer_reviews.text: one of the most comprehensive guides i have seen. definitely worth the money for anyone interested in foraging.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Information abounds
customer_reviews.text: Great study book. Great pictures. I got this just to learn more about my local surroundings. I have learned to identify many plants around me. The book is very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer dad

customer_reviews.title: Color pictures, pocket sized!  Perfect BooK
customer_reviews.text: This book was everything that I was expecting and then some. The only thing that could be better is that it had more of a winter selection but other than that, this should be the only book you need for edible wild plants!!!!!!!! This is literally a one stop shop book, pocket size ! ♥️
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Dont hesitate, buy this now
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend is a nature woman and recently she has been mentioning how cool she thinks it would be to have a book that tells you what plants were edible in the forest/yard/wild. So I surprised her with this book and she and i were blown away at the quality of the book and the contents inside! Definitely something to have in the book collection/ camping sack
customer_reviews.author: trent hale

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Love the pictures and accompanying text---very informative and easy to navigate. Tells you of any similar plants that could be misleading and whether any lookalikes are toxic. Glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice.
customer_reviews.text: Well researched, supporting photos and drawings excellent. Helps identify the plant under discussion as well as noting plants that may be imitators, occasionally dangerous similar plants.
customer_reviews.author: M. McFadden

customer_reviews.title: Good guide!
customer_reviews.text: A very good guide. Definitely deserves a place with my others of the same genre.
customer_reviews.author: arborista

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful gift
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift. The receiver was very please to get the book.
customer_reviews.author: Emerald

customer_reviews.title: Very detailed book
customer_reviews.text: This book is a really great book that has beautiful pictures and out of all of my foraging books this one is the most detailed.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline B.

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with this Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Easy and wonderful guide! Super happy we chose to make this purchase. Looking forward to exploring it more and in greater depth!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Interesting Book
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed looking through the book, and it has sparked my curiosity, but I haven't had an opportunity to venture outside the city to go hunting for wild edibles. I hope to do that in the near future. Worth the price I paid for the book.
customer_reviews.author: EricTop Contributor: Ukuleles

customer_reviews.title: buy this now!!! you know you want it!!
customer_reviews.text: good book, very helpful, well worth the money! i like to eat when i hike, this book will let me have a feast! i already knew some, this book just opened my horizons to new and exciting meals on the trails.
customer_reviews.author: congobongoofthethirdorder

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs one
customer_reviews.text: Good book lots of info good pitchers I keep it up at camp
customer_reviews.author: doug nink

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SOURCE OF INFORMATION
customer_reviews.text: We love the color pictures which really helps with proper identification of plants.
customer_reviews.author: William C. Kemper

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking companion book ever
customer_reviews.text: My second time owning this book. My first copy was so used it fell apart and was held together by rubber bands. I love this book and so do my family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberlee Czarniak

customer_reviews.title: eddible plants
customer_reviews.text: A guide to an astonishing number of identifiable edible wield plants out there well done.
customer_reviews.author: john wendland

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful book for someone just getting into plant ID/edibles
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful book for someone just getting into plant ID/edibles. Great descriptions on what is edible and what is not. It's sectioning by seasons rather than by color or family is brilliant. Worth buying 100%
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Ferry

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband and he loves it! Very useful information to have! Product exactly as described and fast shipment. Would recommend this seller and do business with again. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Renee W.

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars - Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: Informative and accurate. An easy read that should be mandatory for anyone who hikes into the wilderness. A good source for those short walks to supplement a food source close to home. Also important for those preppers who want to stay ahead of the game.
customer_reviews.author: John HuffTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great, inclusive book
customer_reviews.text: Very complete, photos make identification of plants easy, and explanations are easy to understand for how to identify and how to use plants.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Madsen

customer_reviews.title: Oh well
customer_reviews.text: This book is kinda hard to follow. Seems like a lot of useless info. Not as user friendly as I expected.
customer_reviews.author: John Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Great guide for eastern US
customer_reviews.text: Eastern US oriented with good photos. Good detail. The US Army guide to edible wild plants as compared is worldwide, but much less detailed.
customer_reviews.author: dt

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good book for forgers. Good examples and pictures of plants and their uses.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Great Resource
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great book. I bought 4-5 field guides and other wild edible books prior to this one and this is the best. It obviously doesn't cover everything, but it covers a lot. Much better pictures than most books I've seen making for easier identification. Also, the details of habitat, geographic locations all work with the pictures to give me confidence. I also appreciate the recipes. This in conjunction with a more detailed book on key plants is really what most people probably want when looking for books on this subject.
customer_reviews.author: L. Pounders

customer_reviews.title: A very useful tool to have
customer_reviews.text: Great book for identification of edible wild plants just wished that it was organized by region then season in each region instead of just by season.
customer_reviews.author: Tainted1

customer_reviews.title: It's a very good book, with good clear pictures
customer_reviews.text: It's a very good book, with good clear pictures, I bought this book for my boyfriend, a bow hunter, because I know he will enjoy learning new things while he's sitting up in his tree stand. I've grown up in the Adirondacks and want him to know the woods as well as I do.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Delaney

customer_reviews.title: A valuable pictorial resource.
customer_reviews.text: Should be in anyone’s survival library. Like any edible plant book, should be used with care, but in conjunction with outdoor classes, can be an invaluable resource.
customer_reviews.author: Don D Cline

customer_reviews.title: You decide.
customer_reviews.text: Very enlightening book and definitely worth the price but the few pictures that weren’t in color were some of the most important plants! But I definitely like how the book shows you how to prepare the plants you find on your adventures but even that could be a bit more detailed but all in all worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: Great photos and ver detailed description. I didnt realize I had so many editable food around my home
customer_reviews.author: Melissa crawford

customer_reviews.title: A good read
customer_reviews.text: Good book to add to your book shelf , big text huge bright pictures that are clear an easy to see , it is regional so keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good book
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have. Has pictures to go with it as well as recipes.
customer_reviews.author: James Ross.

customer_reviews.title: How to know your plants.
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect book if you are looking to identify plants in your environment either for eating or eradicating!! I like the notation of "Poisonous plant look-alikes". The book is also the perfect size to carry along on jaunts, being sturdy and pocketable.
customer_reviews.author: 1942Granny

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: This is good but there's better books. It's a good addition to my collection. Theres a picture of wood nettle labeled stinging nettle so who knows what other mistakes may be in here. I have a feeling not everything in here is from personal experience and knowledge.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Great information
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for husband's birthday and he loves it. Has so.much information in it.
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Nice book will order again
customer_reviews.text: This is a small book good for a bug out bag or backpack. Small writing.
customer_reviews.author: Kary

customer_reviews.title: Great book to have on hand even if you don't eat wild edibles!
customer_reviews.text: This book is great. We haven't actually tried any of it but it's so much fun to use it to identify different local wild edibles. Someday we may actually try eating some of them too, lol. It's also great for know some of the plants you really want to keep small children AWAY from. We brought this book with us to visit family out of state and lost it so we bought another copy. It's a great book.
customer_reviews.author: Kikyo

customer_reviews.title: Great Resource to Take Along on Hikes
customer_reviews.text: I really like how this book is laid out with real, colorful, clear pictures. Having those definitely aids me in my ability to identity "free food". The use of the edible-use symbols is incredibly easy to understand. This is a great resource to have along with my hiking books and other edible plant books.
customer_reviews.author: By CJs Pirate

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: With the exception of some blurry and not very descriptive pictures. The book delivers what it promises. Very informative and gives good descriptions of each of the plants.
customer_reviews.author: Michael John

customer_reviews.title: Nice descriptions but photos need work as far as clarity
customer_reviews.text: Nice descriptions but photos need work as far as clarity, especially important as this is a wild foraging book and you dont want to confuse similar plants.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Doe

customer_reviews.title: It's not too bad
customer_reviews.text: it's informative and does go into some detail. but do your research elsewhere as well.
customer_reviews.author: Wildlife Up Close

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: a great guide for the west coast as well as other places
customer_reviews.author: audiyo

customer_reviews.title: A comprehensive reference
customer_reviews.text: It has different plants, the seasons they grow in, where they grow, and what parts of them you can eat, as well as poisonous look-alikes to watch out for! Very comprehensive.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Kossa

customer_reviews.title: 4/5 Some of the pictures are in black and white
customer_reviews.text: Only a few are in black and white and they are not the clearest of pictures. But I have carried this book everywhere with me and has been very easy to understand and use.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great book!
customer_reviews.text: Well organized book with great pictures, many of the plants have pictures of both the flower and the leaf which is helpful for identification. The pages are well set up and the location key is a huge help as you can quickly pass plants not found in your area without having to read a paragraph to find the location. Also has a key to show ways you can eat it, so if you are just grazing you can pass up plants that need to be cooked. The only problem i have the book is that about 10 percent of the pictures are in black and white which makes them hard to see.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki B.

customer_reviews.title: It's a good reference
customer_reviews.text: Gives information about a wide variety of wild edible plants. It's a good reference book
customer_reviews.author: Darren Mikesell

customer_reviews.title: Very good. I plan to give this to my nephew
customer_reviews.text: Very good. I plan to give this to my nephew, who does a lot of hiking, and will be going to college this fall near the Smokey Mountains.
customer_reviews.author: D. Frey

customer_reviews.title: Best field guide to wild edibles
customer_reviews.text: This book is by far my favorite of the several edible wild plants guides I have used. The included nutritional information, section on poisonous look-alikes, quality photography, and recipes are all excellent. Furthermore, the organization of the book (by season) and indicated growing range for each plant make it very easy to use. I personally use an old edition, and purchased this one as a gift. The recipient is extremely pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Greenstorm

customer_reviews.title: Weeds for lunch- yummy
customer_reviews.text: like the colored pictures and good definations. Although I don't know if I would eat wild mushrooms without a good expert to teach you. Too many look alikes that are posionous. Well you go first in eating that and if you live I may try it. FYI - most weeds that man tries to kill are very beneficial for humans - dandelions are very good for you.
customer_reviews.author: Bigbluefrog

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Book!
customer_reviews.text: This book is divided into seasons, and which plants are edible, when. If you're a fan of Euell Gibbons, this is an excellent companion piece to his books. My son, who is homeschooled, checked this one out of the library and then shortly, we were looking on Amazon for our own copy for our personal reference shelf. Very informative and well-done!
customer_reviews.author: D. Vest

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise I really like this book
customer_reviews.text: Would have given 5 stars except for the random black-and-white pictures. I bought this book because I'm not eating anything I can't clearly identify and I can't do that from a b/w picture!!!!! Otherwise I really like this book...well-organized and lots of info.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for first time scavengers
customer_reviews.text: Great for first time scavengers. Especially with printed color pictures it give you that extra measure that you are looking at the right plant and not a similar looking plant.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: A 'must' for people interested in edible wild plants
customer_reviews.text: My only regret about this book is that it isn't longer! The plants are organized by season, and every plant has a small map to show what regions it grows in. There is a very nice, good sized picture of each plant, and most of them are in color. Information is also provided about harvesting, how to prepare the plant, and poisonous look alikes, if any. The plants are listed by their common names, but the latin names are listed as well. Plants can be located by either name in the index. If you are interested in edible wild plants, this book is a great value for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie G Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Daughters loves this guide
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my daughter. She and her husband are environmental engineers. They try to live a sustainable life style and part of that is harvesting what is already growing. They have found this text extremely helpful in their endeavors.
customer_reviews.author: wlarson

customer_reviews.title: would be great to have regional maps depicting which plants are located ...
customer_reviews.text: One down side, would be great to have regional maps depicting which plants are located in which areas.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob V

customer_reviews.title: I liked it was weather proof
customer_reviews.text: I liked it was weather proof. I borrowed it from a friend and needed my own once they wanted it back.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BOOK!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT BOOK!!!! Lots of description and pictures are clear. It even tells you about poisonous look-a-likes so you don't do something regrettable. It has wonderful recipes on how to prepare some of the plants and I'm very excited to try some.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Herdklotz

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: Great book. Improve your hikes and learn something. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Chris Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Naturalist
customer_reviews.text: Actually a very useful book, what most people think of as weeds are really useful in a post apocalyptical world. or for a very Nature/Earth friendly person. This book tells you what part is poisonous , edible and gives ideas to provide ways to use the various parts of the plant.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Smith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like that this book has colored pictures and recipes in it. Its a nice field guide to have.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: a good pick for them walkabouts innawoods
customer_reviews.text: Received book on time and in excellent condition. book describes plants accurately and has nice pictures as well as potential threatening look alikes. how plants can be prepared and a tiny picture of the regions of the u.s. they can be found.
customer_reviews.author: Brian R

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: Nice clear colored pictures of plants. Very happy with book and price.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Nature's Guide for Foraging
customer_reviews.text: Perfect addition to owning 'Identifying and Harvesting Edible and Medicinal Plants'. Colors of plants within book aide in choosing the correct plants.

customer_reviews.text: It will be useful if I don’t have access to the internet.

customer_reviews.title: love that this book shows the plants for each season ...
customer_reviews.text: love that this book shows the plants for each season so it is easy to find what you are looking for and the pictures are fantastic!

customer_reviews.title: Love the layout of the book
customer_reviews.text: Love the layout of the book, very detailed descriptions and has a map of the US/CAN of where the plants are found and how to prepare, suggested uses and etc.
